questions.question_text: Which table stored the links from Entity to Entity Types?

discussion.content:
Selected Answer: D
Testbook p114.
sn_grc_m2m_profile_profile_type

Selected Answer: D
Answer: D. [sn_grc_m2m_profile_profile_type]
Explanation: A, B, C don't exist in the GRC applications, only Entity to Entity Type[sn_grc_m2m_profile_profile_type] exit under GRC: Profiles
Source: PDI, sys_do_object list view with filter: name=sn_grc_m2m_profile_profile_type

Selected Answer: D
D is correct

Selected Answer: D

Selected Answer: D
In the Policy Lifecycle: Authoring, after a policy is approved, it is published as a knowledge article in GRC Knowledgebase, thus answer is D: Knowledge Base

questions.question_text: Where does a policy get published to when it is approved?
What GRC module would you access in order to update Entity Types?

discussion.content:
Selected Answer: C
Answer: C. Scoping > Entity Types
Explanation: in the context menu, Entity Types is under Policy and Compliance > Scoping > Entypes, but doesn't matter which entity types you click into on the context menu, they all take u to the Entity Type[sn_grc_profile_type] list with different pre defined filters
Source: DPI, enter "entity types" under the context menu

Selected Answer: C
looked in the PDI to confirm.

Selected Answer: BCDE
Q: All applications on the Store are reviewed and certified, what does that mean?
A: All applications are NOW® Certified. The objective of the certification process is to ensure that the scoped application doesn't put the customers’ ServiceNow instance and associated data at risk. The certification process is a thorough evaluation and testing process executed by ServiceNow in conjunction with the Technology Partner to ensure that their application introduces the least amount of risk possible into your instance and ensures platform stability, performance, and security.

Selected Answer: BCDE
All applications are NOW® Certified. The objective of the certification process is to ensure that the scoped application doesn't put the customers’ ServiceNow instance and associated data at risk. The certification process is a thorough evaluation and testing process executed by ServiceNow in conjunction with the Technology Partner to ensure that their application introduces the least amount of risk possible into your instance and ensures platform stability, performance, and security.

Selected Answer: BCDE
b c d e are correct

Selected Answer: BCDE
All Applications are certified by ServiceNow.

comments.content: You are correct, found the answer in the Store FAQ

choices.E: Applications are built om the ServiceNow platform
choices.A: Some applications are certified by ServiceNow
choices.B: All applications are certified by ServiceNow
choices.D: It houses both paid and free applications and integrations
choices.F: Applications are certified by other developers
choices.C: Applications may be developed by ServiceNow Technology Partners

questions.question_text: What are some characteristics of the ServiceNow Store? (Choose four.)
The ServiceNow Platform requires which external components in order to ingest data from other systems?

discussion.content:
Selected Answer: D
Integration hub offers capability to ingest data from other systems.

choices.A: The platform includes an SDK template that allows developers to enhance it using Java
choices.B: A messaging bus needs to be developed
choices.D: The platform has Integration Service that allow users and developers to ingest data from a variety of sources
choices.C: The platform allows XML to be ingested, and it required developers to leverage XSLT to map it properly
